description: Conversion of single dwellinghouse into two self contained units (1 x one bedroom flat and 1 x two bedroom flat) including rear roof extension (involving conversion of roofspace into habitable use), installation of three rooflights to front roofslope and single storey rear extension
decision_conditions: The development permitted shall be begun before the expiration of three years from the date of this permission.  REASON:	In order to comply with the provisions of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990 (as amended). | The development hereby approved shall be carried out in accordance with drawing title number(s) 237/10 Rev B, 237/11A, 237.12A, 237/13A, 237/14A Rev B and 237/17 Rev A unless otherwise agreed in writing by the local Planning Authority.  Reason: For the avoidance of doubt, and in the interests of proper planning. | All external materials to be used in the development shall match the appearance of those of the existing building.  REASON:	To ensure that the materials harmonise with the surrounding, in accordance with policies 4.1, 5.5 and 5.9 of the adopted Ealing Unitary Development Plan 'Plan for the Environment' (2004), emerging policies 7.4 and 7B of the Draft Ealing Development Management Development Plan policies 1.1 and 1.2 of the adopted Local Development Framework (Core Strategy 2012) and policies 7.4 and 7.6 of the London Plan (2011). | No part of the roof of the extension shall be used as or altered to form a balcony, roof garden, roof terrace or similar amenity area.  REASON: To protect the living conditions of occupants of nearby properties, in accordance with policy 5.5 of the adopted Ealing Unitary Development Plan 'Plan for the Environment' (2004), emerging policy 7B of the Draft Ealing Development Management Development Plan, policies 1.1 and 1.2 of the adopted Local Development Framework (Core Strategy 2012) and policy 7.6 of the London Plan (2011). | Notwithstanding the provisions of Article 3 of the Town and Country Planning (General Permitted Development) Order 1995, no windows or other openings (other than those shown on the submitted plans) shall be formed in the walls or roof of the building permitted.  REASON:To protect the living conditions of occupants of nearby properties, in accordance with policy 5.5 of the adopted Ealing Unitary Development Plan 'Plan for the Environment' (2004), emerging policy 7B of the Draft Ealing Development Management Development Plan, policies 1.1 and 1.2 of the adopted Local Development Framework (Core Strategy 2012) and policy 7.6 of the London Plan (2011). | Refuse storage shall be provided in accordance with the standards adopted by the Local Planning Authority.  Such provision shall be brought into use prior to the commencement of the development and retained permanently.  REASON: To protect the living conditions of occupiers of the area, in accordance with policies 2.10, 4.1 and 5.5 of the Adopted Ealing Unitary Development Plan, 'Plan for the Environment'(2004), emerging policies 3.5 and 7B of the Draft Ealing Development Management Plan, policies 1.1 and 1.2 of the Adopted Ealing Development (Core) Strategy and The London Plan (July 2011) policy 5.16. | A minimum of two (2) cycle parking spaces shall be provided on site in accordance with adopted standards of the London Plan 2011. Such provision shall be brought into use prior to first occupation and retained permanently.  Reason:	To provide adequate facilities for cyclists, in accordance with policy 9.6 of the Adopted Ealing Unitary Development Plan, 'Plan for the Environment'(2004), policies 1.1 and 1.2 of the Adopted Ealing Core Strategy and policy 6.9 of the London Plan 2011. | Prior to the commencement of the development, details shall be submitted to and approved by the Local Planning Authority, regarding the noise exposure category, the BS4142 rating noise and the predicted vibration levels.  The details shall also include noise mitigation measures with windows closed, other means of ventilation provided and mitigation of vibration.  The approved details shall be implemented prior to the first occupation of any residential units and thereafter permanently retained.  Reason: In the interests of the amenity of occupants of the proposed residential units, and in accordance with policies 2.6, 4.1 and 4.11 of the adopted Ealing Unitary  Development Plan, 'Plan for the Environment' (2004) and the advice contained within the Council's adopted Supplementary Planning Guidance note 10: 'Noise and Vibration', policies 1.1 and 1.2 of the Adopted Ealing Development (Core) Strategy 2012 and London Plan (July 2011) policies 7.14, and 7.15.
